description:
Could a strange recurring dream of being part of a team of alien scientists on the moon truly be real? Sensitive Japanese high school student Alice Sakaguchi doesn’t really believe that, of course... until, one night, when she dreams the same dream! Now, even her eight-year-old neighbor is acting strange. Is history really doomed to repeat itself, even when that history carries over from a previous life...?

(Source: Viz Media)

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Horticulture
tags.description: The story prominently features plant care and gardening.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

title.native: ぼくの地球を守って　ミュージック・イメージ・ビデオ〜金色の時流れて
ぼくの地球を守って～亜梨子から、輪くんへ～

node.description:
__Place of Birth:__ Kanagawa Prefecture

[Twitter](https://x.com/hujisunsun_m7) | [Website](http://blog.goo.ne.jp/purasunikki)

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%BA%9D%E5%8F%A3%E8%82%87) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Mizoguchi)

Hajime Mizoguchi is a Japanese cellist and composer.

Mizoguchi started playing piano at the age of 3, and the cello at the age of 11. From 1978-1985 he attended the Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music where he majored in violoncello. In 1986, he released his first album, Half Inch Dessert, being listed as composer, arranger, and performer. From that time on, he has released more than 20 albums including motion picture soundtracks.

His compositions include soundtracks to works such as [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) and [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田祐二) | [Studio Wyeth](https://www.studio-wyeth.jp/)

A prominent art director, as well as the founder and representative director of Studio Wyeth.

_Note: Not to be confused with animator [Yuuji Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/144426/)._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/itsuro_k)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/後藤隆幸)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Mitsuhisa Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103267/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/後藤隆幸)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Mitsuhisa Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103267/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石川光久)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/).

Ishikawa acted as executive producer for the anime sequence The Origin of Ren in Kill Bill, and was the producer of the first two [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/) films. In 2005, Ishikawa joined his first joint Japanese-U.S. collaboration, since the opening of the Production I.G branch in Los Angeles, IGPX: Immortal Grand Prix, a joint production with Production I.G and Cartoon Network. Ishikawa has also produced Batman: Gotham Knight, Halo Legends and Dante's Inferno: An Animated Epic.

He also served as an executive at Bee Train from 1997 to 2006.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%84%E3%81%BE%E3%81%96%E3%81%8D%E3%81%8B%E3%81%9A%E3%81%8A)

Kazuo Yamazaki is a director, animator, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖夫)

Founder of [Audio Planning U](https://anilist.co/studio/6561/), and the father of [Keiko](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/) and [Yasuyuki Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/144509/).

In 2016, he received an Honorary Achievement Award for his role as a sound director in [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/).
Joined Audio Planning U in 1982, where he studied under [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/).
Handles special effects.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/横山正和)

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/itsuro_k)

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/234488/) or the [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/234487/)._

Kanno's earliest experiences with music came from attending church with her parents. She studied keyboard from a young age on both the piano in her home and the organ at her kindergarten. In elementary school, she began participating in composition contests, but in high school, Kanno began to take more of an interest in literature than in music.

She attended Waseda University, where she majored in literature, but she transcribed music for various student groups at Waseda in her free time. While in university, Koei, a Japanese video game company, asked her to compose the soundtrack to Nobunaga's Ambition. The game turned out to be a hit, and Kanno's music career was launched.

Kanno has also composed music for artists such as [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/), [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/) and [Kyouko Koizumi](https://anilist.co/staff/164646/). She is also a keyboardist, as well as the frontwoman for [Seatbelts](https://anilist.co/staff/193673/), who perform many of Kanno's compositions and soundtracks.

She has collaborated with directors [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/) and [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/) multiple times.

In addition to Japanese, she speaks a little English and some French.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%84%E3%81%BE%E3%81%96%E3%81%8D%E3%81%8B%E3%81%9A%E3%81%8A)

Kazuo Yamazaki is a director, animator, screenwriter and storyboard artist.
Affiliated with Studio Wyeth.
